meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.5 ::date 2015-08-20T22:31:17 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt Here are a couple of examples of "marriage" in Civil Law, abolish Civil Marriage and here would be no recognition under the law: · 1. There would be no transfer of property to a spouse (since there would be no such thing as "spouse" under the law. # ::save-date Fri Nov 20, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_5.txt
sentence: Here are a couple of examples of "marriage" in Civil Law, abolish Civil Marriage and here would be no recognition under the law: · 1. There would be no transfer of property to a spouse (since there would be no such thing as "spouse" under the law.

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.6 ::date 2015-08-26T02:55:52 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt As such the surviving spouse would be subject to a tax liability upon the transfer of property between people not recognized as legally married. # ::save-date Wed Sep 2, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_6.txt
sentence: As such the surviving spouse would be subject to a tax liability upon the transfer of property between people not recognized as legally married.

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.7 ::date 2015-08-26T05:24:59 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt 2. It would eliminate the exemption form the Estate Tax applicable to the sale of a primary home, only Civil Marriage does that. # ::save-date Fri Nov 20, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_7.txt
sentence: 2. It would eliminate the exemption form the Estate Tax applicable to the sale of a primary home, only Civil Marriage does that.

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.8 ::date 2015-08-26T00:20:55 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt (When a home is sold a single person can claim up to $250,000 in an exemption, $500,000 for a Civilly Married couple. # ::save-date Sun Feb 7, 2016 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_8.txt
sentence: (When a home is sold a single person can claim up to $250,000 in an exemption, $500,000 for a Civilly Married couple.

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.9 ::date 2015-08-26T07:24:02 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt When one spouse dies the surviving spouse can still claim the married exemption for up to two years after the death if the home is sold. # ::save-date Mon Aug 31, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_9.txt
sentence: When one spouse dies the surviving spouse can still claim the married exemption for up to two years after the death if the home is sold.

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.10 ::date 2015-08-26T08:03:18 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt No spouse, no exemption - the survivor is taxed like a single person.) # ::save-date Wed Sep 2, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_10.txt
sentence: No spouse, no exemption - the survivor is taxed like a single person.)

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.11 ::date 2015-08-26T08:25:07 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt 3. No spousal privilege in the case of a criminal prosecution. # ::save-date Fri Nov 20, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_11.txt
sentence: 3. No spousal privilege in the case of a criminal prosecution.

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.12 ::date 2015-08-26T08:30:45 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt 4. Since there would be no "spouse", they could not be buried in a National Cemetery next to a spouse who was an honorably serving veteran of the United States. # ::save-date Fri Nov 20, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_12.txt
sentence: 4. Since there would be no "spouse", they could not be buried in a National Cemetery next to a spouse who was an honorably serving veteran of the United States.

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.13 ::date 2015-08-26T10:08:40 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt 5. Without the legal recognition of "spouse" there would not be automatic conveyance of parenthood upon the birth of a child. # ::save-date Fri Nov 20, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_13.txt
sentence: 5. Without the legal recognition of "spouse" there would not be automatic conveyance of parenthood upon the birth of a child.

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.14 ::date 2015-08-27T02:28:16 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt 6. Since there would be no spouse, there would be no establish family relationship recognized under the Family Medical Leave Act so that a person can care for their spouse (or be cared for by them) in times of medical emergency. # ::save-date Fri Nov 20, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_14.txt
sentence: 6. Since there would be no spouse, there would be no establish family relationship recognized under the Family Medical Leave Act so that a person can care for their spouse (or be cared for by them) in times of medical emergency.

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.15 ::date 2015-08-27T03:34:39 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt 7. Since there would be no "spouse", employees would become liable for employer portions of health insurance because there would be no waiving of the tax penalty for employer provided health insurance for a spouse. # ::save-date Fri Nov 20, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_15.txt
sentence: 7. Since there would be no "spouse", employees would become liable for employer portions of health insurance because there would be no waiving of the tax penalty for employer provided health insurance for a spouse.

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.16 ::date 2015-08-28T00:24:14 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt (For Civily Married couples, the employer portion of Health Insurance is tax free, however on plans where the significant other is not a legal spouse - then the federal government charges that portion as income and is liable for taxation.) # ::save-date Fri Jan 5, 2018 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_16.txt
sentence: (For Civily Married couples, the employer portion of Health Insurance is tax free, however on plans where the significant other is not a legal spouse - then the federal government charges that portion as income and is liable for taxation.)

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.18 ::date 2015-08-27T23:47:07 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt No "spouse" means no family relationship under Social Security whereby the surviving spouse can receive benefits at the working spouses rate if higher then their own. # ::save-date Mon Jan 15, 2018 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_18.txt
sentence: No "spouse" means no family relationship under Social Security whereby the surviving spouse can receive benefits at the working spouses rate if higher then their own.

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.19 ::date 2015-08-27T23:31:56 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt 9. No "spouse" means no established a family relationship where a spouse can then sponsor their spouse for immigration purposes. # ::save-date Fri Nov 20, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_19.txt
sentence: 9. No "spouse" means no established a family relationship where a spouse can then sponsor their spouse for immigration purposes.

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.20 ::date 2015-08-26T13:56:05 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt and to just round it out to 10... # ::save-date Wed Sep 2, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_20.txt
sentence: and to just round it out to 10...

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.22 ::date 2015-08-27T22:17:24 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt No "spouse" means that military members will not be able to draw pay and benefits for dependent spouses: no housing allowance, no medical benefits for the spouse, no accompanied tours where the government provides for travel expenses of the spouse, etc... # ::save-date Wed Sep 2, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_22.txt
sentence: No "spouse" means that military members will not be able to draw pay and benefits for dependent spouses: no housing allowance, no medical benefits for the spouse, no accompanied tours where the government provides for travel expenses of the spouse, etc...

meta_info: ::id bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105.23 ::date 2015-08-27T13:47:23 ::annotator SDL-AMR-09 ::preferred # ::snt If there is no Civil Marriage, there is no recognition, and so those things all disappear. # ::save-date Wed Sep 2, 2015 ::file bolt-eng-DF-170-181103-8883574_0105_23.txt
